p: The collection of the leaves was done according to a method described by Sebola et al. [ 25], where fresh, healthy C. macowanii leaves showing no apparent symptoms of disease or herbivore damage were collected from the Walter Sisulu National Botanical Garden (Roodepoort, Gauteng, South Africa, 26°05′10.4″S 27°50′41.5″E). After collection, the samples were placed in sterile polyethylene bags and transferred to the laboratory at 4°C before being thoroughly washed with sterile distilled water and used within hours of harvesting.
